sense.name: person who is a business or work colleague
sense.examples: May I introduce my associate from our company, John Smith? The professor's political views are different from many of his associates at the university.

sense.name: person who is a social companion
sense.examples: Sally disapproves of many of her teenage son's associates. The film star's associate at the resort was an underage girl from New York. She is one of my oldest associates from high school days.

sense.name: subordinate membership in an organization
sense.examples: Bob is hoping to make associate at his law firm next year. The young professor has a rank of associate, he's not a full professor yet. He left the financial firm when he realized he'd only make associate and never partner.

sense.name: relation of connectedness between concepts
sense.examples: The psychology study discussed typical associates of color terms in different cultures. Semantic opposites are associates, such as hot and cold, happy and sad, young and old.

sense.name: academic degree awarded by community college
sense.examples: He earned an associate degree at the local community college.
